common

Class RationalNumber2

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • common.RationalNumber2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RationalNumber2
extends java.lang.Number
    Represents a rational number (numerator/divisor) used in TIFF/EXIF metadata.

    This class stores values as 64-bit longs to safely accommodate 32-bit unsigned integers from EXIF specifications. All instances are normalised (reduced to lowest terms with a positive divisor) upon creation to ensure mathematical equality and consistent hashing.

    Since:
    27 November 2025
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RationalNumber2

        private RationalNumber2(long num,
                        long div,
                        RationalNumber2.DataType type,
                        boolean normalise)
        Core private constructor used to handle sign normalisation and fraction reduction. Firstly, it normalises signs (Divisor should always be positive) and then reduces the fraction.
        Parameters:
        num - the input numerator
        div - the input divisor
        type - original data type (SIGNED or UNSIGNED)
        normalise - if true, it reduces the fraction via GCD
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the divisor is zero and numerator is non-zero

      • RationalNumber2

        public RationalNumber2(int num,
                       int div,
                       RationalNumber2.DataType type)
        Constructs an instance handling 32-bit signed or unsigned integers.
        Parameters:
        num - 32-bit numerator
        div - 32-bit divisor
        type - specifies interpretation as SIGNED or UNSIGNED

      • RationalNumber2

        public RationalNumber2(int num,
                       int div)
        Constructs a signed instance from 32-bit signed integers.
        Parameters:
        num - 32-bit signed numerator
        div - 32-bit signed divisor

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares this instance with another object for mathematical equality.

        Equality is determined by comparing the normalised numerator, divisor, and the original data type interpretation.

        Overrides:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation. Returns a decimal if the value is a whole number, otherwise returns the fraction with a decimal approximation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • negate

        public RationalNumber2 negate()
        Negates the rational number.

        Returns a new normalised instance with the numerator's sign flipped. The resulting instance is always cast to RationalNumber2.DataType.SIGNED.

        Returns:
        a negated RationalNumber2 instance

      • hasIntegerValue

        public boolean hasIntegerValue()
        Returns:
        true if the rational represents a whole number
